name: Digit Fern
description: Hemionitis doryopteris, commonly known as Digit Fern, is a terrestrial fern native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Mexico, Guatemala, and Brazil. It belongs to the Pteridaceae family and features upright fronds (15-30 cm tall) with small, dramatic, hand-shaped (digit-like), dark green fronds with distinctive finger-like segments. The plant displays an upright rosette growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in rocky areas and on cliffs in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest to any environment. It's popular among fern enthusiasts for its unique digit-shaped fronds.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Avoid direct sunlight - prefers bright indirect light
Brown edges indicate low humidity or underwatering
